CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 26, 1952, page 14, reads: "'The Spirit' Greets Pittsburgh - Last week the welcome mat was rolled out for tall, vibrant Barbara Thompson of Houston, Tex. The Texas Southern University student representing this year's 'Spirit of Cotton,' stopped off in Pittsburgh for three busy days. While in the Steel City Miss Thompson and her chaperone, Mrs. Daisy Bates, were taken on a whirlwind tour of the town, stopping for a visit to the Courier, the Mayor's office and appearances on several radio and television shows. In the first photo Miss Thompson watches Florence Sando of station WDTV sign the scroll which she carries with her. Barbara appeared on Miss Sando's Sparkle Market TV show. Mayor David L. Lawrence presents Barbara with a key to the city in the center photo while she in turn gives him a miniture bale of cotton as Mrs. Bates looks on. Miss Thompson chats with Gloria Abdou, fashion commentator of radio station WCAE in the last photo. She also appeared on station WHOD. - Harris Photo"
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Barbara O'Cole Thompson and Florence Sando of WDTV signing the "Spirit of Cotton" scroll, seated on sofa in domestic interior with armchair, light colored walls, painting, and potted plant
